Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Check the possible bunch length in Athos: Nicole did a scan in the morning:
  • Stabilization of the Aramis lasing:
    • I open the UV aperture in feedback, and I called the laser group to check. Andreas (Dax) optimized it: see  20030  
    • At the end of this around 630 uJ kind of stable with the feed-back re-enabled
  • Stabilization of the position at the first BPM of bunch 2: see  
  • Asked to Didier to restore the energy calibration of the past. He changed them, and he reported that there was a mistake:
    • We saw a small degradation of Aramis lasing (from 620 uJ to 500 uJ)
    • We needed to re-adjust also the energy gains for Athos, and like this we had 1.25 uJ instead of almost 1.4 mJ
    • When we scaled from 11.2 keV to 7.1 keV we lost the same factor in lasing intensity
    • -> this error does not seem to have a huge impact, so for the moment we came back to what we had this morning, since we start with a better lasing
  • Problem with the PSSS setup: operation tried, and after we asked to C. Arrell. There is an issue with the controls. He called them. In the meantime asked to the Alvra users to run a mono scan to have an idea of the BW
  • Changed beam energy and K
  • Corrected the dispersion from   34589   to  34592  
  • We reached around 710 uJ
  • We got the PSSS online, and the BW seems to be ok: around all the PSSS not more (to be better checked)
  • Checked with Alvra people that BW is ok. About 800 uJ. Saved snapshot, optics and K refs
  • Enabling PSICO on Aramis beamline
  • Around 930 uJ at about 8 PM in Aramis. In the meantime Christoph is checking the pulse reduction in Athos. Agreed on how to do it. He will put an entry in the logbook.
  • Aramis pointing correction together with Alvra
  • Enabling PSICO again on Athos beamline
  • Optimizing losses in Athos to allow for high rep-rates (min. 50 Hz) and to allow a strong streaking with SATMA01-UDCP015 (to maximally reduce the lasing).
    • Before streaking we get 1260 uJ (SATMA01-UDCP015 center position = 0.21 mm)
    • @ 100 Hz: Streaking maximally with reasonable BLM/LLM losses we get 405 uJ (SATMA01-UDCP015 center position = -1.00 mm), high loss signals on SATMA01-DBLM065 and SATUN06-DBLM005 for bunch 2, while only getting a very mild increase in SATUN07-DDRM (well sustainable @ 100 Hz).
    • It might be possible to reduce the BLM thresholds to allow for more streaking, the Athos DOSFET's seem to allow it for the moment.
    • Loss optimization mostly with SATMA01 quads for the undulator region and SATMA02 quads for the dump region. SATCL02 dechirper can have some big impact as well (0.1 mm steps on either horizontal or vertical)
    • @ 5 Hz: Streaking maximally with reasonable BLM/LLM losses we get 270 uJ (SATMA01-UDCP015 center position = -1.10 mm), high loss signals on SATMA01-DBLM065 and SATUN06-DBLM005 for bunch 2, but also getting a quite high increase in SATUN16-DDRM (not sustainable @ 5 Hz, quite likely filling the full DRM alarm range within < 1 hour).

Goals:

  • MD: Check 15 keV in Aramis for standard and LB operation
  • Explore higher photon energies in Aramis
  • Set-up 7.2 keV for next week

Beam Parameters:

  • Laser: 
  • Typical charge: 
  • Beam energy: 
  • Beam destination: 
  • Rep. rate: 

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • reduced the taper in Athos to 3200 to relax the DRPS (~500 m) a bit since the night shift had some DRPS alarms (were around 50% DRPS limit) -> Athos lasing dropped to 4950 uJ but still very good
  • scaled Aramis to 14.5 keV
    • got 360 uJ without any adjustments
    • optimised taper, orbit, SAR quads, and started with phase shifters (ocelot)
    • saved a partially optimised 14.5 keV setting (450 uJ) SF_settings_20250817_084742.snap
  • scaled to 16 keV
    • go 40 uJ initially
    • optimised taper, k-values and phase shifters by hand, reached 180 uJ @ 16 keV
  • attempt different photon energies:
    • some hints of lasing at 17 keV (64063  )
    • 30 uJ at 16.5 keV
  • lasing spot for some photon energies: 17 keV (  64063  ), 16.5 keV ( 64064  ), 16 keV (64065  )
  • We optimize lasing at 15 keV, we obtain 370 uJ.
  • Measured spectra at 15 keV with a monochromator scan: FWHM is around 45 eV or 3 per mil. See 1st attachment to this entry.
  • We go to overcompression mode. We go down in linac 1 phase by 3 degrees. Then increase it until we see similar signal in compression monitor. We adjust the EC sextupoles and we reach around 100 uJ. We remeasure the response and enable the compression FB in BC2.
  • We go and measure the beam with the C-band at SARCL area. It does not look symmetric. We forgot to increase the X-band power to about 18 MW. We do this and adjust the linac 1 phase to get a nicer beam. Measurement:  64066  
  • Measurement at SARCL02: 64068  and  64067  . The dispersion is 0.15 m. Measured beam size is 0.915 mm, corresponding to 0.6% energy spread (rms value), which seems fine. This should correspond to 1.2% rms in the FEL beam, meaning 180 eV.
  • We optimize sextupoles, taper (mostly removing it), quads in BC1/2 and others to reach 200 uJ. Unfortunately, the MC scan does not show any signal above noise. But we should have, based on LPS measurements, a significantly larger bandwidth than before.
  • We try now to operate Athos in paralel. We increase X-band steps in amplitude, we reduce X-band phase steps, match energies in BC1 (SINSB03/4 amplitude steps), BC2 (linac 1 amplitude steps) and switchyard (linac 2 energy). We also adjust laser timing.
  • The problem is that the BC2 compression monitor shows very high signal for bunch 2 compared to bunch 1. It is not possible to run the compression FB for bunch 1 because signal for bunch 2 is too high. We need an independent compression monitor for Athos and Aramis! For the moment we continue with the FB off.
  • We adjust the orbit in the switchyard in the vertical plane (what is not affected by FB). We also optimize phase of linac 1, quadrupoles, orbit etc. We reach 2.3 mJ in Athos with 100 Hz. We could get more but we already show that we can run Atnos with decent performance in parallel to Aramis with LB at 15 keV.
  • We go back to standard BW operation and we will try to push for high photon energies.
    • 16.5 keV (K=0.96). We managed to increase pulse energy to 95 uJ (K of second to last undulator had to be significantly increased). FEL spot; 64069  . MC scan shows something, but a bit noisy: 64070  
    • 17 keV. Still very noisy signal, some FEL spot visible  64071  
    • 16.75 keV (done at the end of the shift). Better FEL spot: 64086  
  • We will characterize the beam for 16.5 keV signal:
    • Bunch length measurement at SARCL01: 64072  (fit was fitting the horn only)
    • LPS measurement at SARCL02:  64073  (proj energy spread is 5.4 MeV or less than 0.1 %)
    • Emittance measurement at SARCL01:   64075  
    • Slice emittance measurement at SARCL01:  64076   and   64077  with more slices -  slice emittance in the core down to 200 nm, mismatch very nice at the core
    • FEL power profile with passive streaker.
      • We set optics 3.
      • The passive streaker can not be moved - motors are not working. A reset of the IOC solved the problem.
      • Measurement at one zero crossing (gap center at 4.95 mm). Lasing on:   64078  . Lasing off: 64079  . the core is clearly lasing, it could be that the horn (head) also a bit. FEL power profile tool gives an error.
      • Other zero crossing (gap center at -4.45): lasing on 64080  , lasing off 64081  
    • Passive streaker measurement for 15 keV:
      • -4.46 mm. Lasing on:  64082   . Lasing off:  64083  
      • 4.93 mm. Lasing off:   64084  . Lasing on: 64085  
  • Note: gas used for pulse energy monitor is Xenon. Is the monitor working well until 17 keV? We will ask Pavle...
  • We restore LB mode for 15 keV and scale to 12 keV. We obtain 550 uJ after some optimization. Measured spectra with MC scan: 64087  . Full width is 2%.
  • Projected energy spread of large bandwidth at 12.4 keV 0.15 m dispersion   64088  
  • Streaked beam no energy resolution:   64090  
  • unstreaked beam in dispersive area:   64091  , 20250817_172541_SARCL02-DSCR280_camera_stack.h5 (stack)
  • LPS measurement dispersion 0.15 m:   64092   (20250817_172541_SARCL02-DSCR280_camera_stack.h5)
  • The camera on screen SARCL02-DSCR280 was not in focus. We moved the lens motor from 1340 to -960 microns (  64093  )
  • LPS measurement with 0.1 m dispersion (SARCL01-170 and SARCL02-280 quads set to zero): (  64094  ), 20250817_174616_SARCL02-DSCR280_snapshot (stack)
  • Projected energy spread (no-streaking)  64095  
  • 5964 MeV central energy
  • centered dechirpers. Starting from open dechirper gaps (10 mm), we stepped through 4, 2, 1, 0.8, 0.6 mm while adjusting structure center position to minimize BPM offsets.
  • Best centers: UDCP200 = 0.3502 mm, UDCP100 =-0.3147 mm.
  • gap scan of both dechirpers:   64096  
  • UDCP200 gap closed, UDCP100 gap open. Observe quad wake blowing up tail   64097  
  • UDCP100 gap closed, UDCP200 gap open. Observe different energy distribution:   64098  
  • UDCP200 gap closed, UDCP100 gap closed:   64099  
  • Moved UDCP200 center offset 10 um:   64100  
  • Moved UDCP100 center offset by 10 um:   64101  
  • Moved UDCP100 center offset by 100 um:   64102  
  • transverse profile at SARCL01-170 when both gaps are closed:   64103  
  • transverse profile at SARCL01-170 when both gaps are open:   64104  
  • transverse profile at SARMA-030 when both gaps are open:   64105  
  • transverse profile at SARMA-030 when both gaps are closed:   64106  
  • moved UDCP200 center to 0.3522 mm. Image at SARMA02-030:   64107  
  • Restored optics for lasing at LB at 12.4 keV
  • Spectrum with dechirper gaps open (430 uJ pulse energy-blue) & with dechirper gaps set to 1 mm (280 uJ pulse energy-orange):   64108  ,   64109  ,   64110  

 

  • Summary:
    • Achieved significant lasing at high photon energies, in particular 370 uJ at 15 keV and 100 uJ at 16.5 keV (with K=0.96).
    • Achieved LB operation at 15 keV with 210 uJ (do not forget: x-band power should be increased to ~18 MW, sextupole optimization is important, undulator taper needs to be reduced).
    • MC scan at 15 keV working well at standard operation (signal to noise ratio was about 4, FWHM BW was 0.3%) but not for LB (increase in BW and reduction in pulse energy makes signal too noisy).
    • Achieved significant Athos lasing (~2.5 mJ w/o full optimization) for LB in Aramis (problem: need to run without compression FB in BC2 due to too high signal in monitor).

 

  • Scale to 7.25 keV, K to 1.75, energy 5.4 GeV, reduce compression and re-optimise: 1.15 mJ -> save REF

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Orbit deviation around SARUN06 (  38243  ), corrector at limit
  • Switched off AR undulator FB, tuned by hand to match orbit with FB targets, measured new RM and switched FB back on, seems to be better (now it converges) now but still no lasing
  • tried addaptive orbit tool (also with kicker and orbit noise) bt did not get more lasing, it improved Athos a bit but not Aramis
  • measured emittance in linac 3 (2700/1120 nm 1.06/1.03):   63949  was 920/540 nm in april 25 (  61671  )
  • measured slice emittance (  63950  ), there was a large mismatch for the core slices (~3) and the core emittance was larger (~1000nm) than usual
  • checked proj. emittance in BC1 (250/135 nm):    63954 
  • checked proj. emittance in BC2 (720/620 nm):  63959  
  • lowered compression (+1 deg in BC2) and remeasured slice emittance but did not improve the core emittance and slice mismatch
  • something between BC2 and Ecol seems to dgrade the core emittance and prevents us from lasing in Aramis
  • Moved the BC1 collimator to check if it is centered, it is, maybe off by 1 mm but not much, it is far from the beam when it is at 40 mm, so it is fine now
  • checked also all other SAR collimators
  • restored quad settings from the morning before all the emittanc emeasurments and cycled quads
  • we see ~13 uJ in Aramis and remove the taper, we get ~60 uJ
  • start optimiseing Aramis at 9.5 keV
    • SINLH01/02 Quads no change
    • SARCL/SARMA quads improved the lasing slightly
    • Check SARBD01-DSCR110 FEL signal shows a nice small round spot (  63961 )
    • Solenoid makes big difference 103.00->103.14
    • adjust compression and introduce taper again we get 350 uJ
    • start with phase shifter scans (full scan range), got up to 370 uJ
  • scaled back to 12.4 keV, had ~60 uJ at 12.4 keV
    • did phase shifter scans again, got 
    • adjusted the taper, compression, X-band, solenoid and gun quads. got 120 uJ
    • optimised LH/BC1/BC2 and AR matching quads, got 160 uJ
    • UV aperture in optimisation does play a role -> got to around 250 uJ with it
  • We rechecked the emittance at the linac 3 end  Emittance measurement  it is around 1070/480 nm and reasonably well matched, so we actually have no emittance blow up and are convinced that the beam quality should be good enough for lasing! We had to update the camera focus positions again (they are applied now) -> SARCL01-DSCR170 focusing positions -> new again after homing the issue why they change is not fully understood, but we definitely found out that the homing procedure of the focusing motor is not reproducible! Pavle and Uros will have to investigate this further.
  • From there on it was sandpapering to bring the pulse energy up to around 970 uJ (PSSS reads 12.32 keV, thanks to Chris A. for setting it up) with the following knobs:
    • SINEG01-DBPM340:REF-FB, UV aperture in FB targets, gun solenoid and corrector quads
    • full round of optics optimisation including LH and SINB03 quad, the other usual knobs in the injector and BC2
    • undulator parameters K, phi, lots of adaptive orbit (especially the last 2 modules needed a bit of convincing to join the party, the K and phase shifters had been quite detuned)
    • small compression adjustments
  • redoing the LH emittance measurement with the empirically optimised beam 222/253 nm 1.08/1.02 mismatch   64025   -> very nice result!
  • enabling the arrival time FB again
  • for reference:
    • B1
      • gun energy scan   64026   -> the fit result is not good, we might have to update the procedure. I left the calibration where it was as this gives the smalles energy spread
      • gun spectrometer   64028  
    • B2
      • gun energy scan   64030   (scan only for reference)
      • gun spectrometer   64029    (used this to adjust the UV delay, so both bunches have the same energy) -> let's see how we fare in Athos with this -> I had to re-adjust the UV delay quite a bit again afterwards, so re-check this once Athos is empirically optimised
  • Athos setup: turned the beam back on and briefly played with the UV delay and the RF steps and got around 420 uJ at 100 Hz. Seeing how many magnets in the common path were touched in Aramis, Athos will probably need a full round of optimisation. Also when I tried to recover a bit again in Aramis, Athos dropped down to 300 uJ again...  -> I leave this to the early shift

  • Summary of the laser-gun setup issues and conclusions thereof
    • Screens:
      • SINEG01-DSCR190 was badly focused -> fixed   63892  
        • Cross imaged on it with the laser   63895  
      • SINEG01-DSCR350 looks as before/expected  63919  
      • SINBD01-DSCR010 the current suspicion is that it was never properly focused until now and we have always made a setup with a blurred beam, but we cannot tell for sure.
        • currently the phased beam looks like this on it (much smaller in y-direction and with a low energy tail that looks quite pronounced   63918  
        • when going to low charge the tail becomes much smaller, so initially we thought that maybe the laser was too much focused, but we do not believe that this is the case as the cross imaging does look rather similar and the bunch length is also good
    • Laser & emittance:
      • adjusted the reference position on the virtual cathode -> we have excellent stability when doing RF focusing with this. However we had the gun orbit FB off when we tried this (see below)
      • did a quick check of the bunch length in the injector 450-475 fs -> looks reasonable   63914  
      • Gun-orbit FB: First I thought about just stabilising the beam where it was now
        • original pre-shutdown values: -0.4 / 0.28 mm (SINEG01-DBPM340 REF-FB X/Y)
        • values after the virtual cathode adjustments: -0.73 / -0.78 mm -> matched the beam with these values
        • values that give the best emittance (just a rough optimisation): -0.4 / -0.47 mm
        • For now I will stay with the values that give the best emittance of 262/300 nm mismatch 1.06/1.04  (beam was matched beforehand, if I put the y REF-FB to the pre-shutdown value, I get a poorer emittance in y)   63928   (SINEG01-DSCR350   63930  ) Solenoid 103.0 A Q1/Q2 6/7 A
    • Transmission
      • injector is phased
      • linac 1 phased, just one station was more than 20 DEG off, but I had transmission right away
      • linac 2/3 -> quite some troubles to get the beam through, worked out in the end, but was tedious all phased now
      • SATCB01 is not yet phased (didn't do any Athos beam at all)
    • Lasing
      • I get pretty much no lasing in Aramis at 12.4 keV, but I also didn't check much yet.
        • Adaptive orbit tool does not start  38222  
        • I tried to measure the dispersion and SARUN02-DBPM showed really weird values in y -> informed BPM experts and disabled it in the FB for now as the beam was running away
        • I touched the SARCL01 quads very quickly, without much luck, needs proper checks tomorrow
      • transmission at 100 Hz works and is loss-free, but we have no lasing -> will switch the beam off for the night

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Currently there are issues with the feedback server, and the feedback is not working. We will continue anyways.
  • Besides, there are timing synchronization issues with the seed lasers.
  • Setup beam for EEHG:
    • Setup single stage compression: we put BC2 straight and optimize the orbit manually.
    • Setup the new SY optics: we restore the optics prepared on June 30 (see ).
    • Scale down the beam energy: we change the S20 energy gain now to 21 MeV (the beam energy is 2.294 GeV now). We change the reference energy for the dipoles in SY. We modify the orbit for transmission.
    • Try changing undulator K value: this changes the beam orbit and hard to optimize under the current situation, so we reverted back to K=2.3184.
    • Increase BC1 compression:
      • First, we measure the current bunch length:   63248  , which is around 120 A.
      • Some DRPS error stop the machine, problem fixed and we continue.
      • Bunch length maeasurement after increasing the compression:   63250  , a new one   63251  , a new one   63252  . Now we have ~500 A current.
    • We minimize the energy spread by minimizing the x beam size at the screen SATCL01-DSCR150:   63253  .
    • We optimize the beam orbit in the undulators, there is some lasing at ~300 eV.
  • We now try to find the seed laser at the downstream screen: We are able to see the diffraction rings (probably from beam pipe) from the 266 nm seed laser.
  • The feedbacks are back, and we start to optimize SASE lasing:
    • Emittance measurement:   63254  , the emittance seems large. We measure again at the laser heater:   63255  , looks okay and is consistent with results on monday. Proceed to emittance measurement at BC1:   63256  , looks okay except that there is some mismatch (mismatch 1.75 / 2.28). We optmize the mismatch and repeat the measurement:   63257   (mismatch 1.74 / 2.00) and   63258   (mismatch 1.77/1.45). We continue.
    • After the optimization, the emittance measurement at Athos:   63260  .
    • Dispersion measurement:   63259  . Looks good.
    • Optimizing beam orbit insider undulator: improving lasing (from ~20 uJ) to ~100 uJ.
    • Change the focusing of the undulator line from 5.1 A to 5.6 A. Now the lasing is abou 150 uJ. There are some loss issue.
  • A TDS measurement at the beam dump:  63261  , so far so good.
  • The timing synchronization issues with the seed lasers is also resolved.
  • Start to setup seed laser 1:
    • We set the K value of the modulators to be 10.2, optimizing the optics, and we get ~70 uJ lasing. We bring in the small chicane for the overlap scan.
    • Start with spatial overlap: on upstream screen: electron beam   63262    .
    • The loss issue is improved by changing the orbit and optics in the undulators. Temporal overlap found: TDS image: without laser   63263  , with laser  63264  (note that the small chicane is 70 A so there is space-charge amplification)
  • Start to setup seed laser 2:
    • We now bring in the big chicane, we change the dipole current to 60 A. This is because we would like a relative small chicane strength (similar to 80 A for the last time). Now that we have 2.2 GeV instead of 3.4 GeV, we need to scale down current accordingly.
    • Start with spatial overlap: upstream screen: electron beam   63265  .  downstream screen  63266  .
    • Temporal overlap found: without laser   63268   , with laser   63267   (note that the small chicane is 70 A so there is space-charge amplification)
  • We will continue EEHG tomorrow.

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Closing the dispersion of SY with the new optics:
    • Dispersion measurement of the current setup:   63225  .
    • Switch to the new optics, dispersion measurement with the new optics:   63226  , The dispersion looks better.
    • Measure the response Matrix with the new optics design
    • With the new optics, we observe a dark current problem: SATSY03-DBLM085, channel 2 shows 200% of reads when the beam is turned off. We close the BLM.
    • Emittance measurement: on the screen looks okay:   63227  , the emittance measurement result:  63228   , looks also okay so we proceed.
    • Test the transport of the whole beamline: looks fine.
  • Beam orbit alignement:
    • Procedure:
      • Close the orbit feedback system, move quadrupole until there is no dispersion. (This is to align the quad w.r.t the beam)
      • Turn on again the feedback system. Change the upstream correctors so that the current corrector goes to 0.
    • Align SATUN05-MQUA420:
      • For the quadrupole, we need to also move the feedback target (to the opposite direction) when we move the quadrupole because they are correlated.
      • We move the x direction +100 um and there is no dispersion. The dispersion along y is almost 0, so we don't change.
      • Now we setup the upstream BPM target (SATUN04-BDPM040). We move the x target up by 150 um, and the corrector current (SATUN05-MCRX420) is 0.
    • Align SATUN05-MQUA080:
      • We move the x direction +45 um for 0 x dispersion.
      • We setup the correctors in the chicane to 0 and cycle the chicane magnets to 0, so that we are sure there is no magnetic field in between now.
      • Question: Is the BPM, SATUN04-DBPM040, mounted with the quadrupole? From our experiement it seems that when we move SATUN05-MQUA080 the feedback target doesn't move accordingly, which is diffferent from SATUN05-MQUA420.
      • We move the quadrupole up (to +491 um) to make the downstream corrector 0 (align the quadrupole w.r.t. to the orbit).
      • Now we steup the upstream BPM target (SATUN04-BDPM010). We need to adjust the y BPM targets (all by around -100 um) so that SATUN05-MCRY420 and SATUN05-MCRY060 has a 0 read.

Huge beam losses at SARUN01-DBLM065.

Check whether the beam-losses have been produced by a Wire-Scanner in a wrong position.

Motor homed, but no improvement of the beam-losses

We observed that moving the motor -500um (absolute position), the beam losses disappered.

Then we tried to verify how many wires are still on place.

We checked that the 2 tungsten wire are alive and in the right position w.r.t. to the deafault garage position

The 2 aluminium wires and instead broken. Then possible explanation of the observed beam losses is that one of the aluminium broken wires is floating and intercepting randomly the beam.

After the wire-alive check the beam losses were not observed anymore either with the motor at the default garage position or sligthly moving the motor +/-1000um w.r.t. the default garage position.

Finally, we decided to keep the motor at the default garage position since no more beam-losses have been observed: probably the floating aluminium wire got burned or removed from the field of view of the beam pipe

Author: Orlandi-Addesa
Title: Suspicious beam losses produced by a possible broken wire in SARCL02-DWSC235

> > Peaks after RF dropout, but a single strong signal at 06:30
> > without RF dropping out
> 
> It looks as if certain MPS alarm / RF delays do not properly work (or the BLM measurement has glitches, or a lot of field emission / dark current is generated) when the machine ramps up again after timing 
interruption (see attached plot).



I checked the RF stations' status around 2025-03-08 04:30 ~ 04:32, when the beam loss was observed with Gun laser beam off. It seems all RF stations had been placed at "RF ON BEAM" state before the beam loss burst 
(see attached figure). This means, the RF delay state was not activated so the reason for beam loss is not the RF delays. Shall the RF stations be put to "RF ON DELAY" state when the Gun laser beam is OFF? 

In the attached figure, I only showed the state of SINEG01, and all other stations have the same values. The value 9 of "RMSM:SM-GET" stands for "RF on beam". The value 5 of "RMSM:RFONB-STATUS" is for "READY".

When I apply Athos radial set points calculated for a given transverse gradient (TGU) in all undulator modules, it usually works well. However, from time to time random single modules seem to fuck up and go back to the original radial set points for a given K. This happens randomly and force me to set the gradient at least one more time. Though it happens seemingly more often when going from larger transverse gradients to smaller ones.

This is especially bad, when I try to do smaller steps in order to let the orbit feedback follow correctly. Because I had it multiple times, that in such a case 90% of modules suddenly decide to go back to their original K position, thus creating a heavily distorted trajectory upon which large beam losses ensue.

We started at around 22:30 after the recovery of the machine DRPS interlcok occuurred during the previous shift

Goal of the shift was the test of the nano-fabricated WS installed in SARCLO1-DWSC160 under "emittance optics settings" which allows us to change the focusing on the WS by simply playing with a quadrupole.

Unfortunately such "emittance optics setting" is also causing an increase of the beam losses expecially for a large defocusing of the beam. Consequently we had to run the WS scan at 1 Hz.

Because of the aforementioned "optics" induced beam losses we were not able to progress a lot in our scheduled plan.

Finally a PSYS interlock (Siemens PLC fault) occured ar around 01;30 which prevented us to continue our working plan

    • When we came Athos was off and Aramis lasing was ~70uJ. BC1/2 phases were at 66.7 and 65 deg (FB at limit) from 67.6 and 68.8 deg, and S10 E-Gain was down 70MeV.
    • We reloaded the BC1/2 settings and corrected the e-gain but still no lasing. Checked different things and noticed that the gun orbit FB was at its limit.
    • Switched off Gun orbit FB, restored SINEG correctors and saw that we had a position of -2/-3 mm in SINEG-DBPM340 (should be -0.4/0.3) and no transmission through SINSB01.
    • Checked all magnets, PS, gun RF and laser position and laser FBs but could not find anything suspicious
    • with the SINEG correctors (160 and 180) we could get the beam to the rerf position in SINEG-DBPM340 and could recover transmission through SINSB01 
    • Phased the gun for B1 again  (was of by ~2 deg) (did it also before we saw the gun orbit FB issue):  56517  
    • Checked Inj. phasing but was fine (of by max ~0.5deg), did not phase L1-3
    • At ~6:30 am Mizar figure of meritt produced an alarm and no image on Mizar VC, called A. Dax who recovered Mizar which was somehow on a completely different setting, A.Dax is investigating what happeded and also checking if the laser caused the issue at 1:15 am.
    • Needed to phase B2 in the Gun again, was of by ~5deg:   56518    56522  
  • After Mizar was back we checked B2 energy in LH/BC1/2, it was of in BC1. We used UV-delay, X-band ampl. and phases as well as Injector steps and BC1-phase to match the enrgy and optimise lasing. Measured new RM for B2-BC1 FB
  • Checked with c. beard and P. Craievich wether the problem with the beam position jumped during he nght could be caused by the Gun/rf, they are investigating
  • With the new gun corrector settings we achieved 650uJ in Aramis and 3.2mJ in Ahtos with both lines at 100Hz and no losses (BLM/DRPS). Losses could be compensated by SARBD and SATBD Quads
  • With Sven we checked what happened again and changed the current of the solenoid by 2A and the beam moved in SINEG-DBPM340 by 0.5mm in x and 1mm in y (Gun orbit FB was off), so we suspect that the solenoid moved somehow which creates this big kick (also Laser and RF experts checked their systems and did not find anything) Archiver data (SINEG-DBPM340 psoitions etc.) for the night    34852

    • optimising the lasing further (K, phi, orbit, optics, compression) we only get to around 725 uJ in Aramis, Athos stays around 3.5 mJ

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Did another optimisation pass for Aramis (quads, orbit, compr. X-band, solenoid, taper, k-values and phase shifters), got back up to 970 uJ again
    • reference setting: AR 12.4 keV 970 uJ (SF_settings_20250816_110907.snap)
  • Started optimising Athos 530 eV LV+
    • Gun steps, UV-delay, X-band steps and BC1/BC2 compr, switched on BC1 FB and measured RM
    • AT quads optimisation and taper
    • phase shifter and k-values
    • got 3 mJ @ 530 eV LV+
    • reference setting: AT 530 eV LV+ 2.9 mJ (SF_settings_20250816_110937.snap)
  • Found that SATUN19 is stuck, went to SwissFEL for power cycle (also informed M. Bruegger via mail)
  • Switched to 530 eV C+ and optimised there
    • after the switch, already got 3.4 mJ
    • optimised AT quads, taper and orbit
    • did a phase shifter scan
    • used ozelot optimiser for phase shifters and k-values, got 5.1 mJ
    • had to adjust the SATBD quads and move the beam dump target due to DRPS and LLM (~500 m) losses above 4.9 mJ, just lower the taper by 200 in case the losses increse further
    • reference setting: AT 530 eV C+ 5.1 mJ (SF_settings_20250816_125340.snap)
  •  Laser gun setup   38272   (including cathode imaging with the cross for both Alcor and Mizar)
  • Reset the figure of merit for Alcor and Mizar
  • Mizar UV aperture position -> enabling FB makes the Athos lasing worse  (manually set B2 to a slightly different y position on the first BPM now, to be seen if we want to keep this)
    • Update: I could only manually set a different value for B2 because the orbit gun FB had been switched off and I had not noticed that. I re-enable it and very slightly adjust the positions to the optimum. I have B2 follow and can fully compensate the drop in performance with the gun RF amplitude steps
  • Bunch length measurement
    •   64054   around 21 fs RMS
    • Also checked SARCL02   64056    64057    64058   -> here I wasn't sure what the best settings are Screen panel:   64055  
  • When I go back to lasing after the BL measurement, my central energy has shifted by around 10 eV on the PSSS (SARCL02 had not been cycled before) and I do lose a bit of performance
  • Scaling to 13.9 keV works pretty well, after adjusting the taper and a bit of adaptive orbit correction, I have already 530 uJ which I manage to increase to around 650 uJ (phase shifters, K, orbit) SF_settings_20250816_201339.snap (reference saved)
  • Chris A. will take over the beam around 9 PM to start commissioning at these uncharted photon energies
  • Started to check the screens, but this needs some work still    38281

Goals:

  • TGU studies in Athos

    • Short pulse mode

Beam Parameters:

  • Laser: 
  • Typical charge:

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Both beam compression feedbacks are Off for bunch 2, we try to enable at least BC1 again, but with no luck. We have to restore the previous settings. Maybe the arrival time drifted a lot.
  • Large BW mode:
    • We set 690 eV, LH, we get about 1.8 mJ (without optimizing a lot).
    • We set a moderate gradient of about 40 in X direction (set in the tool as gradient of y+ 50).
    • We set optics without focusing in the undulator.
    • We can establish decent transmission with manual orbit correction within +/- 0.5 mm. But the beam seems to be very big, since with that orbit we still have significant losses (e.g.  36127  ) at 1 Hz.
    • Measuring very slowly orbit response matrix (only 5 shots per actuator to save time). This is painful to watch, since we have to reset multiple DRM twice during that time. It would be much better if the orbit response could be calculated from quadrupole settings (and also be recalled from a previous save)
    • Orbit correction works more or less fine after measuring the RM (+/- 50 um out from target values). This does improve the losses to some extent, but by far not enough to run at 1 Hz. Still the orbit is not good enough for lasing.
    • We are accumulating too many losses even at 1 Hz (mostly SATUN07, 15 and 22 with multiple DRM resets due to slow RM measurement), so we stop here with the exercise of having no focusing in the undulator. For next time: check optics calculations, try to find a way to calculate response matrix on the fly.
  • We revert back to standard optics. And measure the orbit response again.
  • We see that SATUN21 and 22 quads were set to zero last weekend, but no reason was given in the Elog. We restore them to the values they are supposed to have, which increases the losses a bit in that area (~470 m), but also sharpens a lot the image on SATBD02 screen.
  • We measure FEL power profile for tilted beam (SATCL01-MQUA180 reduced from 8.6 A to 7.6 A) without and with different gradients (relative measurements, uncalibrated):
    • no gradient:   58888  
    • gradient of ~50 in X:  58885  
    • gradient of ~100 in X:  58891  
    • Pulse is not getting shorter with gradient.
  • Trying to fix BC1 compression feedback, new RM does not help. It goes quickly crazy, thus a new working point needs to be searched tomorrow.
  • Fixing Athos undulator orbit to not reach corrector limits and improving manually BC2 compression set-up
  • Reducing DRPS losses around z=470 m by touching matching quads and SATUN21 quad

  • Alcor charge stability optimisation   35240   -> afterwards a lot of optics and orbit reopt were required, the transverse profile is quite different
  • Optimise Aramis 7.7keV:
    • Orbit, optics, taper, k-values and phase shifter, get up to 820uJ at 7.7keV (SF_settings_20241028_131657.snap)
  • Optimise Athos at this compression settings for Aramis
    • Optimise UV-delay, X-band steps, BC1/2 steps (BC2 FB not working I can not get the energy to match in BC2), orbit, otpics, pahse shifter, get 2.5mJ at 580eV LV+
    • Reference file for Athos: AT: 580eV, 2.5mJ, LV+ (SF_settings_20241028_154329.snap)
    • After switching to LH we have losses, use matching quads to reduce losses but only get 2.3mJ
    • Reference file for Athos: AT: 580eV, 2.3mJ, LH (SF_settings_20241028_161625.snap)
  • Bunch length measurements. We observe a strong beam tilt, probably due to leaked horizontal dispersion
    • First zero crossing:   57063  
    • Second zero crossing:   57064  
    • Beam tilt compensation algorithm:   57065  , gives 39 fs FWHM duration.
    • We keep the setting for now, with the X-band phase we can change the bunch length but loose some lasing, should be clarified with users tomorrow
  • Scale Aramis down to 2.5keV, remeasure RM for Linac 3 and Aramis undulator FB and adjust BC2 polarisation filter (7->15deg)
    • First go down to energy gain in Linac3 of 30MeV but there sometimes the RF jumps, probably cause S30CB1 is flipping from 0 to 360deg, increase energy gain slightly
    • Switch S30CB3-13 to RF on beam, should be checked with RF if we want to switch them off till Friday morning
    • Check and correct dispersion   57066  , start with ~300uJ
    • Optimise optics (including BC1/2), orbit, compression, taper (no quadratic taper any more and strong linear), k-values and phases
    • Need several tunig rounds especially K-values and optics get us there
    • We get 880uJ at 2.5keV (SF_settings_20241028_202007.snap) and PSSS looks good, Alvra will so mono scans tomorrow morning and check BW (PSSS pshell not working with LB camera)
    • We optimise Athos at this compression settings again for 580eV
      • Adjust x-band, compression and optics (SATMA01) and get 2.2mJ
      • Reference file: AT: 580eV, 2.2mJ, LH (SF_settings_20241028_202709.snap)
      • Reference file: AT: 580eV, 2.2mJ, LV+ (SF_settings_20241028_205356.snap), again loss issues after switching from LH to LV+

Issues:

I got an email that RKs have problems.

Checking the logs I found that around 21:34 on 17 Oct 2020 MKAC040 control SW detected lost connection with the magnet power supply.

After several not successful attempts to reconnect MKAC040 was automatically put to fail-safe state (to avoid possible further damage).

According to the log file the connection with the power supply in question was reestablished.

Everything else looked normal.

After getting in contact with the control room the RKs feedbacks were turned on.

Made small change of the “Energy SP” to ensure the actual values are properly set.

And both RKs were running without further problems (but they are still in “On delay” mode)

If two bunch operation is necessary they could be used as long as the panel shows “Ready for beam”

I will have an eye at the kickers operation tomorrow to make sure this problem does not reappear.

If you get some further problems please let me know.

M. Paraliev

The Power supplies of S30CB13-MQUA430 & SARCL02-MBND100 are on error. Resetting the PS, switches off the magnet, so we have to re-enable it manually. Happens multiple times.

We call the magnet power supply people. It seems, that the supervision controls are set to tight. This alarm should not hinder operation.

Update: Mike Laznovsky gives us the hint, that the alarms can sometimes be resetted by pushing on the magnet panel the small X button next to the error message. It helps indeed!

Shift:

Official shift crew:

  • Dijkstal, Prat

Other participants:

  • Facchetti

Shift duration: 13:30−02:00

Goals:

  • Establish large bandwidth mode, attempt second order tilt correction, then measure the photon spectrum in the optics hutch with the monochromator and the photodiode
  • Appy linear beam tilt to shorten the pulse. This can be verified again with a measurement of the photon spectrum.
  • Apply second order tilt and obtain two-color FEL pulses. Again measure with the photo diode.
  • Vary the sextupole strength and the orbit to investigate the tunability
  •  

Beam Parameters:

  • Laser: Alcor
  • Typical charge: 200 pC
  • Beam energy: 5.5 GeV
  • Beam destination: Aramis dump
  • Rep. rate: 25 Hz

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Some difficulties in recovering lasing due to funny behaviour of feedbacks (energy and orbit). We recovered FEL up to about 400 uJ, less than before but acceptable for us.
  • Attempt to measured longitudinal phase space at the end of linac 3. Very difficult and unreliable measurement due to much larger time jitter than normal. Straight screen: 15563 ,  15564  , 15565  , 15566  ,   15567   . Dispersive screen: 15568  , 15569  . Time jitter seems to improve when time FB is off. Total energy chirp (RMS) is 2.3 MeV (4e-4).
  • Measured spectrum with MC and diode for this setting. See   15579  . Saved spectra also with PSSS, see 15580  . Full BW around 40-50 eV.
  • Changed to LB mode. We go to overcompression, but then S10CB01 behaves unstably (every now and then it goes on and off).. Called LLRF pikett (Mario). The problem disappears when reducing the voltage from 245 to 230 MV, reason seems to be multipacting. We then called the RF pikett (Alessandro) to see which stations we can increase to recover the 15 MV. We agree with him to increase S10CB03 from 250 to 260 MV and S10CB09 from 230 to 235 MV.
  • Measured bunch length (15583  ) and longitudinal phase-space (15584   and   15585  ) for overcompressed beam. RMS energy spread is 0.6% (33.4 MeV over 5510 MeV). At these settings timing jitter seems to be less of a problem.
  • We get only 7 uJ lasing.
  • We measured and corrected dispersion coming out from ECOL, we had to decrease SARCL02 quads by 0.8%, see 15587  . Lasing increased to 30 uJ.
  • After rematching we get 50 uJ.
  • We measured the slice beam parameters at the end of linac 3 with present settings (15590  ,   15591  ). We set to zero al magnets in BCs, then tilt is much better (15598  , 15599  ).
  • After this we get 80 uJ. After matching optics in SARMA we get 130 uJ.
  • We realized that we had the undulator orbit FB off (!). By restoring it we lose lasing. So we set the BPM values with good lasing to the REF-FB.
  • After that and optimizing orbit (with FB on!) we get 250 uJ.
  • Measured spectra with MC, see  15600   . Full BW around 160 eV.
  • We try to optimize the beam tilt, but it was already quite good. We find that first sextupole in BC2 is very sensitive.
  • With that sextupole at 0.25-0.5A, pulse energy is ~10% higher (275 uJ vs 250 uJ). Spectra for 0.25A at 15605  , and at 0.6 A at 15606  , and at 0.35 A at 15607  . Total BW is similar but shape is slightly different. We stay at 0.25 A, since it is the most symmetric.
  • We try to tune the BW by introducing dispersion with SARCL02.MQUA250 (we do not readjust optics, but we should!). With this trick we also reduce the pulse energy and the pulse duration:
    • +0.5 A. 35 uJ. Spectra at entry 15608  . Total BW is around 50 eV.
    • +0.25 A. 75 uJ. Spectra at entry   15609  and with a better range at   15610  . Total BW is around 70 eV.
    • -0.25 A 95 uJ. Spectra at entry 15612  . Total BW is around 100 eV, shape different than at +0.25 A.
    • +0.1 A. 210 uJ. Spectra at entry . Total BW is around 180 eV, slightly larger than with initial quad value, see 15614  .
    • +1.4 A. 5.5 uJ. Saved spectra at PSSS, but unfortunately most of the shots are not visible (settings are not optimized), the ones appearing have 1 or 2 spikes. Saved also MC spectra at entry 15615  .
  • We get back to the original settings. Try to make 2 colors:
    • SINBC02.MSEX330:
      • -10 A.
        • Orbit difference = 0.25 times orbit difference between sextupole off and on. Rough spectra at  15616  . Pulse energy quite low.
        • OD=-0.5. 15617  
        • OD=-1.  15618  
        • With these sext current we do not see two colors, maybe slightly with OD=-0.5.
      • -5A.
        • OD=0.5. Pulse energy is 95 uJ. Kind of 2 colors, but the lower energy one with higher intensity and the core not fully suppressed, see   15619  and   15620   with finer steps.
        • With OD=1 only one color (the one with lower photon energy), we do not save the spectra.
      • With positive sextupole strenghts photon energy not reduced significantly,we guess that it is compensating some initial 2nd order tilt. No saved spectra.
      • -2.5 A.
        • OD=1. 160 uJ. Spectra at entry 15621  .
        • OD=2. 145 uJ. Spectra at  15622  .
        • OD=3. 95 uJ. Spectra at  15623  .
        • Also two color kind of visible, but again with one with more photons than the other and with the core not totally suppressed.
    • SINBC02.MSEX130.
      • +5A.
        • OD=1. 10 uJ. Only high energy part is lasing. See 15624  .
      • -5A.
        • OD=1. 2.5 uJ. Only low energy part lasing, see 15625  .
        • OD=0.5. 10-15 uJ. Similar behaviour, see 15626  .
        • OD=0.25. 30 uJ. A second color is coming a bit out. See 15627  .
        • OD=0.125. 40 uJ. More two color like. See  15628  .
      • -2.5 A.
        • OD=1. 75 uJ. Spectra at 15629  .
        • OD=1.5. Spectra saved at 15630  
        • Mostly one color.
    • SARCL02-MSEX305.
      • -10 A.
        • OD=1. 1 uJ. Everything killed :)
        • OD=0.5. Also nothing.
        • OD=0.25. Also killed.
      • -5A.
        • OD=0.1. <10 uJ. Only one color. Not saved.
        • 0D=0.05. <10 uJ. Only one color.
      • -2.0A.
        • OD=0.2. 50 uJ.52 uJ. 15631  
        • OD=0.1. 60 uJ. Slightly two colors 15632  
    • S10BC02.MSEX130.
      • -1A.
        • OD=0.2. 30 uJ. Only one color. 15633  
        • OD=0.1. 35 uJ. Kind of 2 colors.  15634  
    • SINBC02.MSEX330 at -5A. 
      • OD=0.5. With SINBC02.MSEX130 to +2A. 15636  
      • OD=1. With SINBC02.MSEX130 to +2A. 15637  
    • With some settings two colors can be seen, but one having higher energy than the other. Data needs to be analyzed....
  • We recovered lasing for standard compression and enabled all FBs. Pulse energy only around 250 uJ. Not clear why, probably related to the vertical distortion we get at around S30CB13 (see below more details).
  • Summary:
    • Obtained LB mode at 8 keV with more than 2% BW. Demonstrated tunability using dispersive quads. 
    • Obtained two colors using sextupoles (for some settings, one color typically with higher intensity than the other). We took many data with different sextupole magnets and orbit shifts. Data needs to be analyzed.  

Difficulties / Beam Time Statistics:

  • Scheduled up time: 
  • Effective up time: 
  • Down time due to: 
    • Beam stopper at the optical hutch closed without any apparent reason. No alarm on our side, but alarm in the optical hutch. After the Bernina guys noticed the alarm they could reset it and beam was back on.
  • Other issues (not resulting in down time): 
    • Problems with the TDC after L3: Large time jitter and no beam on screen after phase flip of 180 degrees. Bunch length measurement does not make sense. Situation improved a bit with overcompressed beam.
    • There is some vertical kick at around S30CB12-13 that changes orbit in the undulator from time to time.
      • This is limiting the pulse energy and making both the pulse energy and the vertical pointing unstable.
      • The orbit jitter after S30CB12 started at the beginning of our shift (in the morning there was no beam there, yesterday it was better), jitter increased during our shift (see 15643  ).
      • Correctors S30CB13 and S30CB14-MCSRY430 were adjusted by the FB to -3.3 and -1.6 A to have straight orbit. If we restore the settings of yesterday we get huge losses.
      • We tried to change TDS settings but we saw no difference.
      • We tried to change a bit the voltages of the RF stations around this area to see if the situation gets better without success.
      • We also tried to change transverse collimator settings, without any noticeable change.
      • No magnet power supply or RF stations seems to behave strangely. Turning orbit feedback in that area also does not help.
      • This problem is limiting significantly the performance of the machine and should be further investigated...

Carlo called back. They are done with the optimisation.

We adjusted the laser diode current of the oscillator to be in the middle of the stability range. With a signal source analyzer we measured a jitter of 18 fs rms, which is good.

The jitter_mon is not improved much, this may be due to teh higher power we have now.

We should monitor the perfomances of the laser oscillator  over longer time.  More details can be found in this entry: https://elog-gfa.psi.ch/SF+Gun+Laser/965

Hiller schrieb:

Carlo called, they are starting with the Mizar jitter optimisation to get rid of the increased timing jitter. Bunch 2 is stopped. They will call back when they are done (around 2 h).
Carlo called, they are starting with the Mizar jitter optimisation to get rid of the increased timing jitter. Bunch 2 is stopped. They will call back when they are done (around 2 h).

Noticed that the pulse energy dropped from around 16:35. Also noticed a large instability on the BAM signals. The timing jitter on all 4 BAMs increased to around 100 fs from around 30-40 fs. 

Cezary looked at various things in SK.023 to see if OMO2 has a problem (synchronization look, optical spectrum, etc.). No obvious problems visible. We could not look at everything as we did not want to lose the synchronization.

Asked Andreas Dax to re-align the Alcor beam on the capillary. He did this and it seems that the drifts in pulse energy are better since then but we still observe the same timing jitter on the BAMs (expected).

I also tried turning off all beam-based feedback loops, but also this has not effect on the BAM jitter. 

The timing jitter measured at the experiment is only 19 fs, also with the large jitter on the BAMs. Most problematic was the drift of the pulse energy, and hopefully, this is now better after the alignment on the capillary. We handed the beam back to the users after a very short interruption for the capillary alignment (around 10 minutes).

SB01-03 are on-crest, SB04 is at zero crossing. The timing jitter arising from energy jitter (10 fs rms) is quadratically subtracted.
R56=63.7 mm

Author: M.Aiba, V.Arsov
Title: BAM3-Jitter measurement at SB04 at zero crossing

We see a strong correlation between the Athos undulator
orbit feedback error and the pulse energy in Athos. We
decide to remeasure the orbit response matrix. The
measurement magicially improves the pulse energy to 260 uJ,
we have no idea why. If we reload old correctors, we still
have the high pulse energy... if we turn off the FB the
pulse energy also stays... 
The bunch length still looks short. 
The feedback seems to mitigate some fluctuations, but the
'big ones' still come through and probably originate much
earlier in the machine.

I had a look and spoke with Pable and Qiao. I see two things that should be checked:

Hiller, Weilbach schrieb:

The Athos beam is very unstable and we are running out of ideas how to fix it. Tobias and I are on the night shifts at the moment and we wanted to make sure that some information gets passed onto you (we will try to join the RC meeting at 14:05, but we are not sure if we’re awake again by then). 

What we noticed so far: 

  • The B1 pulse energy is more or less stable (not the best we ever had, but definitely not horrible). 
  • The Aramis BC1 compression FB error is rather large and definitely not stable (Thursday afternoon it was kind of stable, but during our night shift is kept degrading). 
    • This does not affect the B1 performance significantly. 
    • Overall performance is better with the BC1 feedbacks enabled for B1 (it does not matter much whether you run the arrival time FB or not)
    • during phases for which the B1 compression error is high the pulse energy for B2 fluctuates strongly
  • the Athos BC1 compression FB does not seem to be able to cope with the large FB error of B1 and if enabled it generates losses (the energy FB for B2 a bit less so, but we also feel that we have better performance with it disabled) -> we disabled the energy/compression Feedback  BC1 for Bunch 2
  • What we have tried so far: 
    • improve Athos pulse energy & stability
      • we have tried pretty much every knob, but do not seem to find anything that improves the stability reliably (optics, compression, RF amplitues, phases, UV delay, Mizar cappilary feedback, …)
      • after RF failures in the injector we did lose performance and had to empirically tune back, but there is not 1 single knob we found that could compensate fully. 
      • we also re-measured the responses without a lot of improvement
      • one pending issue is that we noticed that the energy of the two bunches at the LH is quite more different than it used to be  see: https://elog-gfa.psi.ch/SwissFEL+commissioning/29451 -> this is not easy to fix on the fly as it needs a lot of re-optimisation. It could at least partly explain why B2 is so strongly affected by the higher jitter of the BC1 compression FB, but it surely is not the root cause. 
    • decrease Aramis BC1 feedback error
      • here we also tried pretty much everything without much luck, it is unclear if any of the RF stations is responsible for this, we did not see anything on the jitter plots, but maybe Qiao has some more ideas. 
      • we re-measured the response and this did not improve things, we also tried to operate with a different filter for the BCM, but it didn’t improve anything. 
      • we have a stripchart running in the control room with the feedback error and will tell the shift crews about it.

Author: Voulot
Title: Summary of beam instabilities (mainly visible on Athos pulse energy)

The Athos beam is very unstable and we are running out of ideas how to fix it. Tobias and I are on the night shifts at the moment and we wanted to make sure that some information gets passed onto you (we will try to join the RC meeting at 14:05, but we are not sure if we’re awake again by then). 

What we noticed so far: 

  • The B1 pulse energy is more or less stable (not the best we ever had, but definitely not horrible). 
  • The Aramis BC1 compression FB error is rather large and definitely not stable (Thursday afternoon it was kind of stable, but during our night shift is kept degrading). 
    • This does not affect the B1 performance significantly. 
    • Overall performance is better with the BC1 feedbacks enabled for B1 (it does not matter much whether you run the arrival time FB or not)
    • during phases for which the B1 compression error is high the pulse energy for B2 fluctuates strongly
  • the Athos BC1 compression FB does not seem to be able to cope with the large FB error of B1 and if enabled it generates losses (the energy FB for B2 a bit less so, but we also feel that we have better performance with it disabled) -> we disabled the energy/compression Feedback  BC1 for Bunch 2
  • What we have tried so far: 
    • improve Athos pulse energy & stability
      • we have tried pretty much every knob, but do not seem to find anything that improves the stability reliably (optics, compression, RF amplitues, phases, UV delay, Mizar cappilary feedback, …)
      • after RF failures in the injector we did lose performance and had to empirically tune back, but there is not 1 single knob we found that could compensate fully. 
      • we also re-measured the responses without a lot of improvement
      • one pending issue is that we noticed that the energy of the two bunches at the LH is quite more different than it used to be  see: https://elog-gfa.psi.ch/SwissFEL+commissioning/29451 -> this is not easy to fix on the fly as it needs a lot of re-optimisation. It could at least partly explain why B2 is so strongly affected by the higher jitter of the BC1 compression FB, but it surely is not the root cause. 
    • decrease Aramis BC1 feedback error
      • here we also tried pretty much everything without much luck, it is unclear if any of the RF stations is responsible for this, we did not see anything on the jitter plots, but maybe Qiao has some more ideas. 
      • we re-measured the response and this did not improve things, we also tried to operate with a different filter for the BCM, but it didn’t improve anything. 
      • we have a stripchart running in the control room with the feedback error and will tell the shift crews about it.

Author: Hiller, Weilbach
Title: Summary of beam instabilities (mainly visible on Athos pulse energy)

From time to time, the FEL signal shows strong fluctuations, typically leading to a drop in averaged pulse energy as well. Not clear where this comes from. The losses don't go up and it always seems to recover again. It is however also visible on the orbit feedback errors, so probably it originates somewhere early on in the machine.
We'll keep an eye on it

RF trip on conditioning.

reset.

RF trip auf conditioning.

reset x1 gemacht

Lost FEL signal after an RF trip.

Compression ECOL Feedback had to be disabled, as it was pulling the signal away from the optimum, and its actuator was at the upper limit: S10 Phase reached 69.2 degrees.

After disabling the feedback, we found the FEL signal back, however with a phase of 68.0 degrees, which is lower than the lower limit of 68.5 degrees.

Aramis pulse energy is now between 5 and 6 µJ, Athos is around 45 µJ.

Another short RF trip causes a similar problem (SINSB04). This time the signal is still very small, so not a problem. I wait 2.5 minutes, but nothing happens. So I move out the 1% filter by hand. The CDR immediately jumps to the "Running" state, even thought the polarizer angle is still set to 0.0 deg. I also move it by hand. Now everything is working again.

Mäder, Probst, Thomsen,Kittel schrieb:

Der 1% Filter konnte nicht ausgefahren werden, das Signal war zu Hoch nach einem Strahlunterbruch.

S10:SET-BEAM-PHASE-OP angepasst danach hat es funktioniert und der Filter ist alleine ausgefahren. Jedoch stand der Detektor direkt auf Running, waehrend der Polarizer immer noch auf Null stand (und sich auch nicht bewegte). Wir haben dann manuell den Polarizer angle gefahren. Erst dann funktionierte wieder alles.

Author: Kittel
Title: CDR problem nach HF ausfall S10CB07

Suddenly the machine goes crazy in some degraded state. Losses in Aramis beam dump and degraded lasing both lines. I reduce the rep-rates and let it calm down a bit. The CDR filter was reduced to 6.0, I bring it manually back up to 7.0 (since it does not move on its own). Once everything is stable again I slowly bring the rep.rate up. Everythings seems be back in a stable mode now. Not sure what happened actually, there was no RF trip (maybe some instability?).

Author: Kittel
Title: SINEG01, SINSB01/02, S20CB01, SINLH2-MBND and many MSOL suddenly off

I adjusted the temperature setpoints for all RF BOC water cooling loops so that the temperature is more or less the same when the station is active when compared to inactive. This makes it faster for a station to come back on beam after a trip.

I added a few channels to PSICO and gave it the possibility to slightly change also the Linac 3 phase. The setting should be fine for the entire night.

Shift:

Official shift crew:

  • N. Hiller (MO), E. Prat (RC)

Other participants:

  • F. Loehl, C. Kittel

Shift duration: 8:00−18:30

Goals:

  • Photon delivery
  •  

Beam Parameters:

  • Laser: Alcor
  • Typical charge: 200 pC
  • Beam energy: 3 GeV
  • Beam destination: Aramis
  • Rep. rate: 10 Hz

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Florian's optimization tool was running over the night with great improvements getting the pulse energy up to 300 uJ   5894  
  • 320 uJ were reached after some taper optimization (E. Prat)
  • After the recovery of the cooling interlock the FEL signal was rather unstable (200-280 uJ) and we wanted to find out what was causing it.
    • For the first time, we added a mirror in the UV laser path (SLGTV-LMTO-M051:MOT), to compensate for arrival time drifts of the laser -> a 120 fs step increased the signal from 240 back to 310 uJ and the signal looked more stable again (still drifts in the order of 10 uJ) -> we find out work is being carried out in the timing room (increases temperature and humidity in there), we also see that there are GLS warnings present for the humidity in the laser and the timing room (no one is working in the laser room). -> should be investigated properly at some point
  • We compare systematically the settings before and after the optimization run during the night, which brougth from 190 uJ to 310 uJ. To do that we restored the original settings of different parameters:
    • shaping crystals and aperture  -> no significant impact. We stay at the original settings.
    • gun knobs (gun phase, solenoid and corrector quads): no significant impact. We stay at the original settings.
    • compression 15-20 uJ. We stay at the optimum settings
    • Undulator matching quads -> no significant impact. We stay at the original settings.
    • Orbit X: 50 uJ (from 315 to 265uJ)
    • Orbit Y: 60-70 uJ (down to 240 uJ)
    • Orbit X and Y: 100-110 uJ (down to 205 uJ). We stay at the optimum settings.
    • Orbit difference between original and optimum setting is 11 um rms and +-25um peak to peak, see entry 5908  
    • Conclusion: optimization from 200 to 300 uJ was mainly due to trajectory in the undulator, and a little bit due to compression.

Fixed a problem with the water cooling for the four quadrupoles in the switchyard.

The four magnets are running again now.

 

Cause of the problem was: after 15 minutes, the system logs out the local user, and then EPICS overwrites all the parameters with zeros.

Subsequently, the system overheats.

Changed the settings, such that the local user does not get logged out automatically.

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Status in the morning:
    • Aramis 950 uJ at 8.4 keV
    • Athos 2.95 mJ at 536 eV 25 Hz
    • We need 38 nJ for 200 pC Checking how much laser power is needed for 200 pC
  • They didn't manage to get more than 1 mJ in Aramis yesterday, so it is still not clear what is limiting us.
  • checked the gun -> 0.5 DEG off
  • phased whole machine and recovered lasing, also checked the dispersion -> back at 1 mJ
  • Athos: recovered it after the phasing and adjusted it a bit, also measured a new response Re-measured BC1 Athos FB response -> 3 mJ and 100 Hz
  • Aramis optimisation with Sven
    • they found out yesterday that the first few undulator modules do not contribute a lot and the gain length is very long. I also notice that the taper is a lot stronger than in 'old' snapshots, so I take out the last 4 modules, at first I only get like 30 uJ like this, this can be improved to around 200 uJ  (taper, K scans and lots of orbit with noise)
    • we then add the last modules and optimise further, we get to around 900 uJ total, but have to grossly optimise the orbit again and then the first modules stop contributing again, Sven also tries the optics to gain a bit more, but we cannot reach more than we had in the morning.
    • we decide to restore the undulator settings from the morning (but keeping the optics improvements), we get around 1060 uJ
    • Sven absorbs the FB targets in the quad and undulator positions and then decides to do a BBA
    • The BBA causes some DDRM interlocks. We need to reset them.
    • After the BBA we have max. 2 uJ lasing. However, also Athos lost some lasing (3 mJ -> 640 uJ), but in the end it looks something moved the mizar again by a few ps. We resolve this issue separately
    • The Aramis lasing cannot be brought back easily. We suspect, that the orbit position changes are too big to stay in the good field region of the undulators. It would have been good to scale the undulator position after each iteration. Right now an independent undulator alignment would be necessary, but the Bernina beamline is not yet available with the necessary photon diagnostics.
    • We revert all changes from the BBA and improve the Aramis lasing by tuning the usual knobs.
  • CDR state machine tests were successful and we leave it deployed, possibly testing more tomorrow at lower charge.   32128

Goals:

  • Measure the two color FEL with the PALM and the passive streaker
  •  

Beam Parameters:

  • Laser: Alcor and Mizar
  • Typical charge: 200 pC +5 pC
  • Beam energy: 6.95 keV
  • Beam destination: Aramis
  • Rep. rate: 100 Hz

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Laser position optimization at 7.5 keV to get up to 1.25 mJ
  • Setup of the two color check the phase in the gun spectrometer and on the injector TDC.
  • Set the machine to have larger spectrum and longer pulse. FEL spectrum single color 42350  and two color   42351  
  • Bunch length measurement 42352   44 fs (we decide to make it longer)
  • We changed the compression in BC2 and the xband to make the beam longer: corresponding bunch length measurement indicate 113 fs rms  42353  
  • After a lot of twiking we could not get at the same time large bandwidth and long pulse with sufficient energy. Not all the bunch is probably contributing to the lasing.
  • rms of the energy of the electron beam 1%. the lasing part of the electron beam has an energy spread of 0.75%  42357  
  • Passive streaker current profile reconstruction showed 25 fs rms / 85 fs FWHM current profile
    • TDC measurements 25 / 23 fs rms
      • /sf/data/measurements/2022/01/23/140391537_bunch_length_meas.h5
      • /sf/data/measurements/2022/01/23/140391764_bunch_length_meas.h5
    • These bunch durations are much shorter than we expected, since BC2 compression monitor showed all the time (since we changed the electron pulse duration to 113 fs) values around 500. Possible issues with BC2 compression monitor. Alternatively, the monitor simply does not show useful values for beams with a strong energy chirp, and because of this we changed the compression values in a wrong way. To be checked with more frequent TDC bunch length measurements in a possible follow-up shift.
  • We restore the Mizar laser settings. We try to retore lasing in Aramis and Athos (w/o BC1 compression FB). We can restore Aramis lasing. Unfortunately, we cannot get Athos to operate without losses. This is most likely because of the lack of active BC1 feedback. We leave Athos turned off.

  • Other issues (not resulting in down time): 
    • BC1 compressor feedback stopped due to an ND filter not working properlh 23114  
    • Bunch length measurement tool crashes after saving results to h5 file. Saving to logbook was not possible on 3 occasions. Sometimes it worked.

Author: Hiller, Kittel
Title: Draft of measurements for the undulator alignment and calibration campain

Here is a summary of the fire inside the SwissFEL technical gallery on 6.7.2024 and ifts aftermath impacting beam operation: 

Sunday 6.7.2024:

On 6.7.2024  at around 12:30 a fire alarm went off in the SwissFEL building OSFA following an RF failure of SINSB04. The Würenlingen and PSI fire departments responded and were able to swiftly bring the situation under control. After smoke was cleared from the affected parts of the building, the SINSB04 high-frequency modulator was identified as the source of the fire.  Attached are 3 photos taken on 06.07.2024

Detailed info in the RF group elog:   6751     6752   

SwissFEL was then switched off "until further notice" (in the end it was until 17.7.)

Monday 7.7.2024:

Following the police fire inspection on Sunday, the RF and Operations sections, together with area coordination and SwissFEL management, discussed the next steps this morning and decided on the following plan:

  1. SwissFEL beam operations will remain suspended this week in order to carry out the necessary evaluations, both on the technical and operational side.

  2. There will be no user operations at SwissFEL before the planned summer shutdown (nominally July 22nd to August 14th).

  3. Whether beam operation for machine studies (without the damaged RF station SINSB04) is possible and sensible next week will be decided at another meeting on Thursday morning.

  4. After some first clarifications, it should hopefully be possible to present a mid-term plan for the repair work by Thursday. It is currently unclear whether regular user operations will be possible again by the end of August.

Info in the RF elog:   6753  

Thursday 11.7.2024:

After another meeting between the RF and Operations sections as well as area coordination and SwissFEL management this morning, we can announce the following points regarding SwissFEL operations:

  1. The repair of the RF modulator SINSB04 is underway but will take several weeks. 

  2. Operation of SwissFEL without this modulator is currently considered safe. If further RF tests are successful by the end of the week, SwissFEL beam operation is expected to resume on Monday.

  3. Next week the SwissFEL facility will be available for machine studies only. The main objective is to find an operating point at which SwissFEL can generate X-ray pulses (with limited power) without SINSB04.

  4. The summer shutdown begins as scheduled on Monday, 22 July at 7:00 a.m.

  5. There is a great risk that the modulator SINSB04 will not be available by the end of the shutdown (14 August), and therefore only limited SwissFEL beam operation will be possible until further notice.

Mon 15.7.2024: 

After closer inspection of the RF-connectors inside the modulators, the RF group found some signs of damage, which hint at a systematic problem with these connectors. For the moment they are not comfortable switching on the modulators without some additional monitoring. 

Wed 17.7.2024 - Fri 19.7.2024: 

  • RF group checked the smoke alarms and the subsequent switching off of all S-Band stations   6754  
  • Beam operation started around noon (10 Hz and SINSB04 not available). 
  • Shift summary:
    • Wed:   34517  
    • Thur:   34530  
    • Fri:   34546  â
  • Operation was stopped in the evening of Friday 19.7.24
  • Conclusions: Operation at 10 Hz proved to be cumbersome and was afflicted by strong beam instabilities. Nevertheless, the machine was set up at reduced beam energy in BC1 and BC2. In BC2 also the angle was slightly increased to compensate the increased beam chirp. The beam quality (emittance and compression) looked good. However, only some lasing was achieved, around 10 uJ @ 7 keV photon energy. It is estimated, that we should be able to reach 50-60% of the "normal performance" without SINSB04, so there remains still work to achieve some decent lasing after the shutdown.

Mon 22.07.2024

  • Official start of the SwissFEL summer shutdown.
  • Beam operation will start again on Wed 14.8.204 (without SINSB04)
  • SINSB04 will most likely not be available for the startup, but only some time in September -> more updates will follow.

  • Conclusion(s)
    • mysteriously the emittance got better during the night, especially in y direction and B1 and B2 are not super-identical at the moment
    • Need to check with the BD experts how concerned we are about the double-bunch structure during the emittance scan, also with the nominal optics, the bunch looks like this on SINSB03-DSCR110   52652  
  • As all the magnets in front of the emittance measurement are the same as yesterday, I check the gun to see if it can explain the changes
    • Gun energy scan B1 phase is good, but energy is up to 7.115 MeV/c   52660   (gun amplitude at 7.120 MV) -> I reduce it to the nominal 7.1 MeV/c (gun amplitude 7.103 MV)
  • Emittance optimisation : We stay now with these settings: Solenoid 103.07 A, iris reduced to 1.8 mm with this the emittance is 240/248 1.05/1.1   52687   after matching, for B2, we also reduce the iris to 1.8 mm 285/271 1.15/1.17   52696 
  • Optimising lasing:
    • with the newly optimised emittance, we go through the machine again and optimise, after about an hour of empiric optimisation (Eduard & Tobias), we reach around 960 uJ in Aramis, so already pretty good, but still a way to go.
  • Athos setup:
    • amplitude steps of SINSB02 had no impact on the beam   32093   now it does not influence B1, but we have some tuning range
    • 'phased' SINSB02 for bunch 2, the phase steps must be +20 for max energy gain, adjusted the RF amplitude steps for SINSB01 and SINSB02 to have the same energy as B1 in the LH
    • with this we get already 2.2 mJ in Athos and things look much more stable than before
    • re-adjusted the SINSB03/04 amplitude and phase step workings points -> measured a new response. The tuning range on the compression signal is pretty small with the RF steps of SINSB03/04, but with the SINXB01 phase steps this can be achieved easily.
  • Trying to do a bunch length measurement in SARCL01, but the screen does not work via BSread, so the screenpanel stays empty (  32096). Edwin and Alex Gobbo are investigating and find a camserver node not working properly.
  • Meanwhile we put the beam back to work on other things, but Athos position has changed in the gun area (  32097).
  • Aramis setup:
    • doing a gain curve measurement. The tool seems to work fine. But the result shows, that we saturate quite late (  52700).
    • Measuring compression in ECOL:    52718 ,    52719  ,   52720  , we use the X-band to improve the bunch 2 profile and change the CDR filter to 8.0 (and adapt the compression targets)
    • Correcting dispersion:     52721
    • Trying to optimize various settings  (optics, taper, K & phase scans, etc.). However, it seems the first few modules don't contribute a lot. Eduard suggests that it might point at a bad alignment, so we should think about asking Sven to make an Aramis BBA.
    • The Aramis K values were scanned an lie rather close together. So the K-gap calibration seems to be better then last year. Maybe this is due to more correct tunnel temperatures (  32101)?!
  • Athos setup:
    • After compression change in Aramis we loos a lot of lasing. Recovering to 1.1 mJ by adjusting the targets. Philipp finds a bit later, that we are actually overcompressing in Athos. Reducing the compression gives us nearly 2 mJ again, but the feedback targets are now in their limits.
    • Tuning compression further and a few other knobs (taper, optics). BC2 comp. FB is working again, and BC1 comp. FB is at the limits, but only small energy deviation visible. However, the general tuning creates big losses in SATCL02 (z=372 m), so that we can't go to 100 Hz anymore.
    • The beam looks quite tilted in horizontal direction. We try to fix it, but then the lasing goes down. We find a middleground where we get 3 mJ with a reasonably good looking beam:    52742
    • Tuning the losses down, brings unfortunately also the lasing down (BC2 compression, UV delay, optics in switchyard and SATCL01). We settle for now at ~2900 uJ at 50 Hz

      • erst ohne Noise, falls die Pulsenergie noch nicht so hoch ist, wie erwartet, kann es helfen den Orbit Noise zuzuschalten
    • PSSS (Grid, Crystal und Energie muessen korrekt gewaehlt sein) und UV Filter (SARBD01-DSCR110:SET_SCREEN1_POS) wieder einfahren
    • ueberpruefen, dass die Photonenenergie auf dem PSSS wie gewuenscht ist (kann evt. um 10-15 eV verschoben sein, falls noetig mit den Undulator K-Werten skalieren)

 

  • Wechsel von hoher Energie (> 6 keV) auf 2.5 keV
    • Kompressionseinstellungen fuer tiefe Energie laden (macht man dies vor dem Energiewechsel, so sollte man Verluste vermeiden koennen)
      • Athos stopper einfahren, 10 Hz fuer B2, dann B2 komplett stoppen
      • fuer Aramis
        • Aus dem Snapshot: SFB_COMPRESSION.* & zuegig S10MA01-DCDR080:AL1-POL-DES
      • B2 wieder starten (10 Hz auf Athos stopper) -> ueberpruefen, dass die 2 Bunch Feedbacks hinterherkommen -> stopper oeffnen und auf 100 Hz gehen
      • Athos benoetigt vermutlich ein paar Minuten, bis sich alle Feedbacks eingependelt haben
    • PSSS ausfahren (Grid, Crystal auf 'None') und UV Filter (SARBD01-DSCR110:SET_SCREEN1_POS) ausfahren
    • jetzt geht es weiter mit dem eigentlichen Energiewechsel
    • beide Bunche stoppen
    • Laden von MAG and RF Einstellung aus Snapshot
      • S.*REQUIRED-OP
      • S30.*SET-E-GAIN-OP
      • SAR.*MB.*P-SET
      • S30.*MQ.*I-SET
      • SAR.*MQ.*I-SET
      • Zyklen der S30/SAR Quadrupole und SARCL02-MBND (z.B. mit dem Knopf 'Cycle Magnets' auf dem Energy Change Panel im Tab "Aramis ECOL")
      • SAR.*MS.*I-SET
      • SAR.*MC.*I-SET
      • SARUN.*UIND.*:K_SET
      • SARUN.*TAPER.*
      • SARUN.*:PHI_SET
      • SARUN.*REF-FB   und auch den SARBD02.*REF-FB -> wichtig fuer das Dump Feedback und um Verluste zu vermeiden
      • S.*COL.*  (inkl. ECOL!)
    • zunaechst B1 mit 10 Hz wieder starten, es sollte keine Verluste geben -> Rate auf 100 Hz erhoehen und B2 auch wieder zuschalten
    • Neue Response-Matrix fuer Linac 3 (3.1-3.3) und Undulator Aramis messen
    • Dispersion fuer Aramis ueberpruefen und falls noetig korrigieren
    • Adaptives Orbit Feedback fuer Aramis
      • erst ohne Noise, falls die Pulsenergie noch nicht so hoch ist, wie erwartet, kann es helfen den Orbit Noise zuzuschalten

Moegliche Fehlerquellen / Ursachen fuer Verluste

  • bei unerwartet tiefer Pulsenergie
    • uebepruefen, wie stark die Apertur SARFE10-OAPU044 zugefahren ist (5 mm sollten bei 2.5 keV definitiv nichts abschneiden)
  • Bei Verlusten:
    • Im Aramis Beam Dump Bereich muss der BPM Offset unter Umstaenden ziemlich weit angepasst werden (z.B. -2.2 mm).
    • Kollimator-Einstellungen -> falls sie sehr aggressiv eingestellt waren, kann es helfen, sie zu oeffnen (S30, SAR, SAT)
    • Athos: 2-Bunch Feedbacks ueberpruefen!
  • das Ein- und Ausfahren des PSSS schliesst den Photonenshutter -> kann einfach wieder geoeffnet werden, nachdem Kristall und Grid gefahren sind

Other participants:
