Shift duration: 10:00−18:00

Goals:

  • Characterize electron beam - longitudinal phase space and emittance, gain curve.
  • Check undulator K calibration
  • Go through the undulator without focusing.

Beam Parameters:

  • Laser: Alcor
  • Typical charge: 200 pC
  • Beam energy: 5.8 GeV
  • Beam destination: Aramis dump  or stopper
  • Rep. rate: 10 Hz

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Reduce total energy to 5.78 GeV so that S30CB13 can be taken offline, switching to the deflector S30CB14.
  • Longitudinal phase-space measurements at SARCL01/02 area:
    • Bunch length around 40 fs RMS, peak current around 2 kA, time jitter of electron beam (including TDC) is 10 fs, measurement resolution is 3 fs. See  13076  .
    • Core slice energy spread around 800 keV, see 13077  , 13078  .
  • Emittance measurements:
    • Measurement conditions: phase advance steps of 15 degrees, averaging results over 5 shots in each measurement point. 
    • Slice emittance measurements:
      • 5.8 GeV: We do 5 measurements to check reproducibility, see entries  13080   to  13084. Core slice is 291, 295, 294, 294 and 300 nm, very reproducible. Emit = 295+-3 nm.
      • 2 GeV.  Entries 13096  to 13100 . Emittances are 220/220/221/217/222. Emit = 220+-2 nm.
      • 3 GeV. Entries 13101  to  13103. Values: 244, 251nm. Emit = 248+-5.
      • 2.5 GeV. Entries  13104   to 13010. Values: 241, 238 nm. Emit = 240 +- 2.
      • 2.25 GeV. Entry  13106  . 229 nm.
      • 1.75 GeV. Entries 13109   to 13111  221/214/223  nm. 219+-5 nm.
      • 4 GeV. Entries 13112  and  13113  . Emittance is 269/266, 268+-2nm.
      • Slice emittance measurement summary, see entry  9907  . Constant value around 220 nm or 1.75 and 2 GeV. For higher energies measured normalized emittance increases. up to around 300 nm for 6GeV. This is consistent with a resolution issue with the screen. Resolution limit and true value seems to be about 220 nm emittance, corresponding to ~50 um of beam size at the screen for our beam optics.
    • Projected emittance:
      • 5.8 GeV. See entries 13085   to 13089. Emittances X/Y values are 464/400, 473/424, 470/402, 458/409, 470/413 nm. EmitX = 467+-6 nm EmitY = 410+-10 nm.
      • 2 Gev. Projected. Entries  13090  to 13094. Emittances X/Y are 405/297, 389/306, 410/308, 395/297, 400/309 nm. EmitX = 400+-8 nm, EmitY = 303+-6 nm.
      • After few hours pause due to DRPS limits (which we used to do gain curve measurements and other things) 5 measurements per each energy....
      • 6 GeV. Entries 13118   to 13122. Emittances X/Y: 557/402, 552/392, 496/381, 488/407 and 560/378, EmitX = 531+-35nm. EmitY = 392+-13.
      • 5 GeV. Entries 13123  to 13127 . Emittances X/Y: 524/343, 500/352, 474/354, 483/363, 525/349. EmitX = 521+-40 nm. EmitY = 352+-7nm. 
      • 4 GeV. Entries  13128  to 13132. Emittances X/Y: 470/377, 433/379, 425/373, 482/358, 491/371. EmitX = 460+-30. EmitY = 371+-8nm.
      • 3 GeV. Entries 13133  to 13137. Emittances X/Y: 442/386, 433/376, 436/385, 437/374, 429/381. EmitX = 435+-5. EmitY = 380+-5nm.
      • 2 GeV. Entries  13138  to 13142. Emittances X/Y: 397/433, 448/426, 419/432, 421/421, 347/433. EmitX = 406+-38. EmitY = 429+-5nm.
      • Summary entry:9907   . Something seems to have drifted between first and second set of measurements (also lasing went down from 550 uJ to 400 uJ, we had some LAM problems in between). It is not clear the behaviour in Y for the second series of measurements, it could be related to different matching or some kicks which get stronger for lower energies. Anyway, projected emittance seems to be around 400 nm in both planes, or better.
  • Tested gain curve measurement with screen SARBD01-DSCR110. Official tool from Chris needs to be debugged, meanwhile we did it with a matlab script.  See entry 9915   . We can measure 4 orders of magnitude. Gain length is 2.2 m.
  • Measured contribution to lasing of each undulator, see  9917  . As suspected, first undulator part seems to contribute less.
  • Measured the orbit response when opening the undulators while the feedback is off (  9916  ). There is a clear exactation of an betatron-orbit ocillation around the beginning of th eundulator line. Ideally the precalculated entrance and exit kick should not add any kick to the orbit, making the change of the gap transparent to the orbit.

    • At some point during the ACHIP measurement the laser spot had drifted up by about 2 beam diameters (1 mm iris) and also the beam got rather unstable. We then went back to the gun spectrometer, increased the charge and let the laser feedback bring the position back, but this alone did not solve the problems. There was a strong beta-beating starting right at the gun, the gun phase and gun energy both were off and we readjusted them and then did an orbit correction up to SINLH01 which at some point worked and reduced the beating (not on the first go). Later on, we also had issues with the orbit feedback running us into very high values (8 A) in the horizontal plane on S10CB01-MCRX230. When we got all this fixed, the beam did look good again.

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Laser alignment done with pshell, measurement summary at entry   463 . Final (optimum) position is 456/168, before (based on Saturday measurements) it was 457/160.
  • Solenoid alignment done with pshell, measurement summary at entry   464. Final solenoid position is -1.0mm in x, -0.5mm in y, all the angles to zero (see entry   465). This gives slightly smaller trajectory excursions than previous position (see entry   455).
  • After laser and solenoid alignment, the beam at the first screen has a trajectory offset of about 800 um in x and practically negligible in y (see entry   466  ). This is much better than what was measured last Saturday, see entry 434 . As on Saturday (entry   432 ), we still lose the beam at SINEG01-DSCR350 and need quite strong correction to center it (see entry   467)
  • Measured orbit jitter at first gun screen as a function of beam size (obtained with different gun solenoids), see entry   468. Orbit jitter is generally below 5% of the beam size, unless for very small beam sizes.

There is now a new button top of the Athos undulator overview panel (see image) to change the polarisation of all undulators simultaneously.

Thanks to Stefan Maeder for adding it!

Beware: If the "Radial Read" is below 5 mm (typically for a K larger than around 2.4) the undulators will not move due to a safety interlock. In this case their gaps first have to be opened, e.g. by setting a K than 2.4 or lower, for the shift motor to be allowed to move!

Shift:

Official shift crew:

  • Reiche, Hu, Kittel

Other participants:

  •  

Shift duration: 09:00−22:00

Goals:

  • Single stage compression for Athos beam
  • Minimize energy spread
  • Investigate energy modulation with UV laser

Beam Parameters:

  • Laser: Both
  • Typical charge: 200 pC
  • Beam energy: Full
  • Beam destination: Dumps
  • Rep. rate: max 50 Hz

Achievements / Conclusions:

  • Setting up Aramis and Athos for normal lasing before changing setup (SATCB01 is taken off. Photon energy of Athos is 430 eV
  • Setting both modulators to resonance (E=3164 MeV, K=14.22).
  • Setting up one stage compression:
    • BLMeas for the normal setup at SINDI02:   53414  . We compress more at BC1, to 300A:   53415  . Compress more to ~500A:   53416  .
    • We set BC2 straight, and look at bunch length at Aramis. BLMeas at S30CB14, also shows a current around 500A:   53417  . Corresponding longitudinal phase space measurement:   53418 ,  showing an energy spread of ~1 MeV.
    • We work on Athos beamline now. The Athos bunchs have a larger compression, so we change the RF step to recover the beam profile. We optimize the energy spread at SATCL01   53419  . BLMeas at beam dump:   53420 .
    • For Athos, we optimize the optics, taper, optical clystron chicanes to get a lasing of 450 uJ, 330 eV.
    • Sliced energy spread is optimized, and around 0.45 MeV currently, the phase space:   53421  .
    • We restore lasing to have an output of ~300 uJ.
    • We take a energy spread measurement using optical clystron effect: photon energy 1030 eV, power output maximizes at chicane delay 1.3 um, which corresponds to an energy spread of 0.233 MeV ( sigE=E*lambda/(4*pi*delay)=3165*1.4e-9/(4*pi*1.3e-6) ). The measurement with fast signal is in  53428  .
  • Scanning overlap in modulator 1:
    • We begin with 800 nm seed. X direction beam optics needs to be changed after we change the modulator K value.
    • Because the microbunching is small currently, an amplifier is applied to find electron beam signal for the coarse timing overlap on the oscillscope.
    • We find the fine timing overlap by delay scanning. We measure the energy spread with a seed laser of 650 uJ in pulse energy, 130 fs FWHM. Measurement without seed laser:   53434  ; with seed laser:   53435  . With a dispersion of 0.345, we get a beam size 60 um when the laser is off, 250 um when the laser is on. This indicates an induced energy spread delE=3.1 MeV, and an A factor of ~5.6.
    • We turn to 266 nm seed now. Phase space:   53436   . Energy spread measurement without seed laser (the slicing is wrong and has a long tail, so the measurement looks strange):   53437  , the beam size is around 43 um which correspond to energy spread of ~0.38 MeV.
    • We find the overlap by scanning again. With a 200 uJ seed laser, we try optimizing the transverse overlap and the modulator K value, now we have a beam size of around 75 um. With these numbers, the delE is estimated to be 0.80 MeV, the sigmaE0 is estimated to be 0.39 MeV, which correspond to A~2. We will continue to optimize tomorrow.

Title: Generic scan tool not usable for undulator delay scans because it has the comparison limits set very tightly for CHIC delay

Various test measurements with bunch length and energy loss measurement tool. The following issues were found (and will be resolved as quickly as possible):

Bunch length tool:

  • Prepare tool also for vertical streaking in SATMA02:
    • Combo box to select vertical/horizontal streaking (only for SATMA02) - DONE
    • Horizontal/vertical slicing (default camera setting) to follow choice of streaking plane
    • Correct image rotation for vertical streaking in SATMA02
  • Display of bunch number and destination: when both bunches are active, the tool shows B1/B2. Need more elaborate algorithm to determine which bunch is measured and what its destination is.
  • Bug in overlay of current profile and fit on streaked-beam image when displaying second zero-crossing (see e.g. ELOG 46300)
  • FWHM value from camera (optional instead of Gauss fit)

Energy loss measurement tool:

  • Data acquisition problem: time out can lead to number of collected shots being different from number of expected shots, giving rise to errors in the plotting. Fixed the data acquisition (longer time out), but the plotting should be able to handle incomplete datasets.
  • Gas monitor reading (for comparison) should consist of 50-100 shots, averaged with error.
  • Gas monitor reading (for comparison) should appear on summary plot.
  • elog: remove options "Athos beamlines" and "Aramis beamlines" - they do not exist in the ELOG!
  • Reduce number of digits shown in summaries.

We apply 2 orbit bumps to reduce losses: 1) a vertical one of +500 um in SATMA01-110 (close to the stopper) to reduce LLM readings in SATMA, 2) a horizontal of 350 um and vertical one of 200 um in SATUN06 (just before the DRM loss in SATUN07). The effect seems much more sensitive in X. We also adjust SATSY01-MSEX050/250 a bit. With this we get 900 uJ and 100 Hz operation seem feasible. 
  • Optimization of the phase shifters brings ~1.2 mJ of pulse energy. Gain curve measured looks good (but last 2 undulators contributing little), see 36319  .
  • FEL spot images at 36320  and   36318  
  • Restoring 7.5 keV file (September 1st, 22:40h) for Aramis. We get 600 uJ and 0.13% BW right away. We verify that the pointing is still correct.
  • Saved snapshot (600 uJ @ 7.5 keV in Aramis, >1.2mJ @ 720 eV in Athos). We stop Athos and switch off SATUN quads and correctors for the test tomorrow. We enable Aramis undulator knobs in PSICO.

    • Aramis:
      • gun energy scan showed the gun amplitude to be rather low, so we increased it to be centered again

    • Athos:
      • we find that we have to move the Mizar delay quite a bit by 1 ps in order to have a decent range of the feedbacks
      • restoring the undulator settings
      • slight tuning of the gun RF settings
      • we get around 560 uJ

Author: Hiller, Boll, Kittel, Prat, MÃ¤der, FÃ¼glister
Title: Shift summary Mon 06-Sep-21 08:43

Chris Arrell gives us a panel where we can look at the position distribution on various detectors in the Aramis beamline. It shows at the odd and even pulses and thus the distribution between the two sets of 50 Hz. The distributions show a running average of 3000 to 5000 shots.

On the SAROP21-PBPS133 one can clearly see two peaks in Y direction, with a distance of -34 um. In X direction there is a similar distance (-27 um), it is just not as clearly visible in the histogram, since the jitter is a factor 3 stronger than in Y direction.

I added a link to this jitter panel under the "Photon/X-ray diagnostics" folder in the SF launcher!
